question:
You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, professional responses. Take care to ensure the code you generate is executable for demonstration.

Please help me implement the following requirement using SVG code. The requirement is to create a: Japanese kimono is a traditional garment.

checklist.title: Is the kimono's basic structure and proportions accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code accurately depicts the fundamental elements of a Japanese kimono including the main body (hon-mi), sleeves (sode), collar (eri), and obi (sash). Check if the proportions follow traditional kimono measurements where sleeve length typically extends to ankle level and body width allows proper draping. Score 0 if basic kimono silhouette is missing, 5 if only simplified outline is present, and 10 if all structural elements are properly proportioned and positioned.

checklist.title: Are traditional kimono design elements and patterns authentically represented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG includes authentic Japanese design elements such as traditional patterns (seigaiha, asanoha, sakura, etc.), proper color combinations following seasonal conventions, and accurate collar overlap (left over right). Check for cultural authenticity in decorative motifs and pattern placement. Deduct 5 points if patterns are culturally inappropriate, 3 points if collar overlap is incorrect. Full score requires authentic traditional elements.

checklist.title: Is the SVG technical implementation properly structured and optimized?
checklist.description: Assess whether the SVG uses appropriate technical approaches including proper use of groups (<g>), paths, and geometric shapes for efficient rendering. Check if the code utilizes SVG-specific features like gradients, patterns, and transforms effectively. Evaluate if the coordinate system is well-organized and if the viewBox is properly configured. Deduct 5 points if excessive nested elements cause performance issues, 3 points if basic SVG optimization principles are ignored.

checklist.title: Does the kimono design demonstrate proper fabric draping and fold simulation?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG successfully simulates the natural draping characteristics of kimono fabric through curved lines, shadow effects, and layering. Check if the obi (sash) shows proper dimensional depth and if sleeve draping appears natural. Evaluate the use of gradients or shading to create fabric texture illusion. Score 0 if completely flat representation, 5 if basic draping attempt, 10 if realistic fabric simulation with proper depth and natural flow.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code can handle common rendering issues across different browsers and screen sizes. Check for proper error handling in path definitions, valid color values, and scalable design elements. Code with strong robustness should render consistently across platforms, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if major rendering issues exist, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes creative enhancements that elevate the kimono representation (e.g., 1. Interactive hover effects revealing pattern details 2. Animated elements like flowing fabric or seasonal transitions 3. Multi-layered depth with subtle animations). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path definitions or duplicate elements 2. Unnecessary complex patterns that don't enhance the kimono representation 3. Excessive decorative elements that distract from the main subject. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core kimono elements are obscured by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG code organization including proper use of definitions (<defs>), reusable elements, and clean structure. Check for consistent naming conventions, proper indentation, and logical grouping of related elements. Deduct 5 points if code structure is chaotic or lacks reusability; deduct 5 points if excessive code duplication exists; deduct 5 points if the SVG lacks proper semantic organization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional aesthetic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the kimono design follows authentic Japanese aesthetic principles: 1) Harmonious color palette respecting traditional combinations 2) Balanced composition with proper negative space 3) Refined detail level appropriate for the medium. Deduct 3 points for each visually jarring element, 5 points for culturally inappropriate color choices, and 5 points for cluttered or unbalanced composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the visual presentation smooth and well-rendered?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG renders smoothly with clean lines and proper anti-aliasing: 1) Smooth curves without jagged edges 2) Proper stroke-width consistency 3) Clear visual hierarchy and readable details at various scales. Deduct 5 points for each major rendering artifact, 3 points for inconsistent line weights, and 5 points for poor scalability. The full score is 10 points.
